title: Ticket #1947: Daemon ClassAd Hook params for wrong name
description:
If an individual Hook Manager is not 'named', the jobs under it will param for the incorrect parameter. For example: 

STARTD_CRON_JOBLIST = test

...
STARTD_CRON_TEST_MODE       = periodic
STARTD_CRON_TEST_EXECUTABLE = $(LIBEXEC)/test
...

The code will param() for STARTD_TEST_MODE and STARTD_TEST_EXECUTABLE instead.

If instead, the Hook Manager had been named, the code works as expected. 

STARTD_CRON_NAME = hawkeye
HAWKEYE_JOBLIST  = test

...
HAWKEYE_TEST_MODE       = periodic
HAWKEYE_TEST_EXECUTABLE = $(LIBEXEC)/test
...

This old behavior is, as of 7.5.6, documented as unsupported and going away (primarily because it's confusing), but still works.

I believe that this same behavior exists in all 7.x releases of Condor, but because the naming feature is used, it's gone undetected.
